ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] all I can say is hmmmm
ygData.msgSnippet: Well, this is a bit different Talies.  Imagine you are a live together couple that have parted ways, now you can actually keep your character when you split.
ygData.messageBody:
Well, this is a bit different Talies. Imagine you are a live together
couple that have parted ways, now you can actually keep your character when
you split.

Kitasi

-----Original Message-----
From: Talies the Wanderer [mailto:snicker@...]
Sent: Friday, July 06, 2001 10:47 AM
To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [eqbards] all I can say is hmmmm


At 11:35 AM 7/6/2001 -0500, you wrote:
>Seems to me that with what they are charging - it's going to be a "profit
>center" for Verant. I'm concerned that Bards will be the type of character
>where we'll see significant E-Bay'ers. I expect to see a lot of bards in
SS
>and POG armor with no idea how the songs work - let alone twisting.
>
>I don't really understand the mentality. I know I'm not alone in feeling
>the early levels could be among the most fun - and learning the class was a
>blast. I really enjoy getting tells from people who've found me randomly
>with esoteric questions about being a bard - and stuff that's rarely used
>(had one recently about the Identify Magic song).


Anyone from DragonRealms remember the stink made when they announced
platinum service?

*grumbles*
I didn't sub to that, and I won't sub to it here. I think it's a
disgusting practice, to separate people based on economics.

Talies the Wanderer


Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to lol@...
with the subject submissions.
